'''''Spirou et Fantasio''''' (''Spirou and Fantasio'') is a Franco-Belgian comic strip that began its run in 1938. The series shares many characteristics with other [[European comics|European]] humorous adventure comics like ''[[The Adventures of Tintin|Tintin]]'' and ''[[Asterix]]''. It is one of the most popular classic [[Franco-Belgian comics|Belgian comic strips]] and, unlike Tintin, new Spirou books continue to be published to this day.
+
'''''Spirou and Fantasio''''' (French: ''Spirou et Fantasio'') is a Franco-Belgian comic strip that began its run in 1938. The series shares many characteristics with other [[European comics|European]] humorous adventure comics like ''[[The Adventures of Tintin|Tintin]]'' and ''[[Asterix]]''. It is one of the most popular classic [[Franco-Belgian comics|Belgian comic strips]] and, unlike Tintin, new Spirou books continue to be published to this day.
[[Spirou (character)|Spirou]] and [[Fantasio]] are the series' main characters, two adventurous [[journalist]]s who run into fantastic adventures, aided by Spirou's pet [[squirrel]] [[Spip]] and their inventor friend the [[Champignac|Count of Champignac]].
[[Spirou (character)|Spirou]] and [[Fantasio]] are the series' main characters, two adventurous [[journalist]]s who run into fantastic adventures, aided by Spirou's pet [[squirrel]] [[Spip]] and their inventor friend the [[Champignac|Count of Champignac]].
